main event: A sighting of a very bright star-like object, along with a meteor-like object, was recorded in Klamath Falls, Oregon on March 14, 1955.
interesting points: The brightness of the first object was notable, suggesting it was very prominent in the sky., The duration of the observation was between 25 to 30 seconds., The first object was observed to have a long observation period., The second object was described as meteor-like and flew from south to north., The first object was evaluated to be possibly the planet Jupiter by the University of California Observatory.
